Learn More

Overview

Thanks for visting my website! My name is Dan McGinn. I'm an avid learner and adventurer with a passion for design. I studied at Tufts University where I received my B.S. & M.S. in Mechanical Engineering with a focus on Design for Emerging Markets and Robotics. Since graduating undergrad in 2018, I've been working at Dassault Systèmes SolidWorks. After completing my graduate studies in 2019, I was promoted to SolidWorks Product Manager. As a Product Manager for SolidWorks, I manage our portfolio of cloud based design and engineering apps called the SolidWorks Cloud Offer. In my free time I enjoy being in the outdoors especially with friends and family. My favorite activities are backpacking and skiing, although I'm always looking for new adventures.

Portfolio

Product Manager for the SolidWorks Cloud Apps
2019-Present

As a SolidWorks Product Manager, my responsibilities include learning from customers to understand engineering workflows, leading R&D initiatives to better serve our customers, and promoting the value of our apps to customers, resellers, and executives. I’m an expert SolidWorks user and I have a foundational understanding of engineering workflows.

3D Models View 3D Printer with WebGL
3D Models Renderings & Screenshots of 3D Models

Robotics Programming Platform for Students
2019

I worked at the Tufts Center for Engineering Education & Outreach (CEEO) for 2 summers in college. In 2019, I worked with LEGO Robotics to develop an easily deployable web-based programing platform for students. The platform provided a web-based programing interface that made it easy for students to connect to LEGO EV3s and follow along with guided tutorials to program in python.

Screenshots Screenshots of the User Interface
GitHub GitHub Repository

Design for Emerging Markets
2018

For my senior design project, I designed and built a fatigue testing machine for a company in India that designs and manufactures modular roofing tiles for village homes. I lead a team of 5 engineering students and I personally designed and fabricated the mechanical assembly. I travelled to Ahmedabad, India to install the machine prototype. I received the 2018 James P. O’Leary Award for this project, an award that is presented annually to a Mechanical Engineering senior at Tufts University who has made outstanding contributions in the area of design.

EngineeringDrawings Engineering Drawings & Pictures of the Assembly
YouTube Design for Emerging Markets Fundraising Video

Medical Device Invention
2017

During my Junior year of college, I co-invented a surgical device for ocular surgery. My roommate, a Biomedical engineer, identified a problem with the current process for injecting medicine into a patient’s ocular cavity in surgery (a common practice in surgery for treating macular degeneration). I came up with a new design to stabilize pressure in the ocular cavity while injecting medicine. We worked with the Tufts Office of Technology Transfer to file a patent for the design. We’ve since abandoned the patent due to a lack of market interest, but I gained valuable experience during the process of trying to create a new invention.

Patent International Patent Application (PCT)
Patent U.S. Patent Application

Adventurer
1996-Present

I enjoy being in the outdoors in my free time. For most of my summers in college, I worked as a backpacking guide in the Rocky Mountains. Nowadays I spend a lot of time skiing and backpacking in the White Mountains. In March 2022, I had the opportunity to go spring skiing on Tuckerman's Ravine. In this picture, I'm preparing for the hike up Mount Washington.
